elementMetadata.description: Add an Microsoft Visual Studio Team Service Instance to connect your existing VSTS account to the Collaboration Hub, allowing you to manage work items. You will need your VSTS account information to add an instance.
elementMetadata.name: Visual Studio Team Services

configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector
configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter

configuration.description: The VSTS account subdomain, i.e. examplevsts
configuration.name: Subdomain

configuration.description: Visual Studio Team Services OAuth Token Revoke URL
configuration.name: OAuth Token Revoke URL

configuration.defaultValue: vso.build_execute vso.code_full vso.code_status vso.connected_server vso.dashboards vso.dashboards_manage vso.entitlements vso.extension.data_write vso.extension_manage vso.gallery_acquire vso.gallery_manage vso.graph_manage vso.identity_manage vso.loadtest_write vso.machinegroup_manage vso.memberentitlementmanagement_write vso.notification_diagnostics vso.notification_manage vso.packaging_manage vso.profile_write vso.project_manage vso.release_manage vso.security_manage vso.serviceendpoint_manage vso.symbols_manage vso.taskgroups_manage vso.test_write vso.wiki_write vso.work_full
configuration.name: OAuth Scope

configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings
configuration.name: Default select fields

configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses
configuration.name: Filter null values from the response

description: Add an Microsoft Visual Studio Team Service Instance to connect your existing VSTS account to the Collaboration Hub, allowing you to manage work items. You will need your VSTS account information to add an instance.

resources.description: oauth token exchange
oauth token refresh
List all queries. Add depth to retrieve child queries

path.x-samplevalue: Shared Queries/Website team/Active stories with tasks

wiql.x-samplevalue: SELECT [System.Id],[System.WorkItemType],[System.Title],[System.AssignedTo],[System.State],[System.Tags] FROM WorkItemLinks WHERE ([Source].[System.TeamProject] = @project AND [Source].[System.WorkItemType] = 'Product Backlog Item' AND [Source].[System.State] <> 'Removed') AND ([System.Links.LinkType] = 'System.LinkTypes.Hierarchy-Forward') AND ([Target].[System.WorkItemType] = 'Task') mode(Recursive)

parameters.description: Add depth to retrieve child queries, i.e. depth = 2
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description: The page number. Defaults to 1 if not provided
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The page size. Defaults to 200 if not provided. Maximum of 2000
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Api-version to be used for the request, i.e. 5.0-preview.2
parameters.name: version

resources.description: Create a query or move a query

wiql.x-samplevalue: select [System.Id], [System.Title], [System.State] from WorkItems where [System.WorkItemType] = 'Bug' order by [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.Priority] asc, [System.CreatedDate] desc
select [System.Id], [System.Title], [System.State] from WorkItems where [System.WorkItemType] = 'Bug' order by [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.Priority] asc, [System.CreatedDate] desc

parameters.description: Api Version to be used, i.e. 5.0-preview.2
parameters.name: version

resources.description: Delete a query or a folder. This deletes any permission change on the deleted query or folder and any of its descendants if it is a folder. It is important to note that the deleted permission changes cannot be recovered upon undeleting the query or folder.
Retrieve a query and it's children

path.x-samplevalue: Shared Queries/Website team/Active stories with tasks

wiql.x-samplevalue: SELECT [System.Id],[System.WorkItemType],[System.Title],[System.AssignedTo],[System.State],[System.Tags] FROM WorkItemLinks WHERE ([Source].[System.TeamProject] = @project AND [Source].[System.WorkItemType] = 'Product Backlog Item' AND [Source].[System.State] <> 'Removed') AND ([System.Links.LinkType] = 'System.LinkTypes.Hierarchy-Forward') AND ([Target].[System.WorkItemType] = 'Task') mode(Recursive)

parameters.description: Add depth to retrieve child queries, i.e. depth = 2
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description: Include deleted queries and folders. Please note that it retrieves result as per the depth selected i.e., if there are no included items in the selected depth you may not be able to differentiate the results.
parameters.name: includeDeleted

resources.description: Update a query or a folder. This allows you to update, rename and move queries and folders

parameters.description: The APi-Version. Provide along with preview if needed
parameters.name: version

parameters.description: Api-version to be used for the request, i.e. 5.0-preview.2
parameters.name: version

resources.description: Search for work-items

parameters.description: The page token of resources to retrieve
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for specfic work-item ids = 30,31,32 then the where clause is given as `System.Id in (30,31,32)`. Example2: To search for title = "API title" then where clause is System.Title = 'API title'. When this parameter is omitted, all ids are reurned as defined by the paging.
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of requested fields. Example: System.Id,System.Title
parameters.name: fields

resources.description: Deletes the specified work item and sends it to the Recycle Bin, so that it can be restored back, if required. Optionally, if the destroy parameter has been set to true, it destroys the work item permanently.

parameters.description: Optional parameter, if set to true, the work item is deleted permanently
